poem:
**As Far Away as Possible**

They fire the rocket;  
Earth's small animals  
lift their heads,  
hoping the metal prayer  
will take us far.  

Two monks bend  
over the chessboard:  
this time, no cheating.  

A thumb bleeds on the mandolin,  
old tin-scar remembered.  

In the birthday ward  
names thin to one.  
Nurse.
